comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Born in 1902, Wilhelmina was only eleven when this photo was taken. They appear to be members of the horsey set, dressed for an equestrienne performance.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: NYT on November 16, 1913, carried a report of the opening day (November 15) at Madison Square Garden of the 29th annual National Horse Show, in which eight countries are participating. The festivities opened with a bunch of children (all under 12), riding ponies. The Ruperti girls probably were performers in this event.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Sheila Byrne was another minor who rode horses, portrayed in a Bain/LOC image:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2556388140/]

comment.author: 49965511@N03
comment._content: If you separated these girls outfits and made them into several different looks they would be relevant today. I love the classic equestrian style of clothing. I even own several pieces that would compliment these ladies with no problem.

comment.author: 9248280@N02
comment._content: Beautiful glass plate. You LOC guys do such a great job!
